item.title: E.C.B. Weighs Whether to Extend a Lifeline to Greece
item.description: The European Central Bank has already lent about $120 billion to banks in Greece, which need the cash to continue providing credit to the economy.
item.dc:creator: JACK EWING and LIZ ALDERMAN

item.title: Lens Blog: On Mount Everest, Surviving an Earthquake and an Avalanche
item.description: Roberto Schmidt had gone to Mount Everest to work on stories a year after Sherpa guides died in an avalanche. Then a massive earthquake hit, triggering an avalanche that buried the base camp.
item.category: Far East, South and Southeast Asia and Pacific Areas
item.dc:creator: JAMES ESTRIN
item.media:credit: Roberto Schmidt/Agence France-Presse â€” Getty Images
item.media:description: The Pasang Sherpa searched through flattened tents for survivors after the avalanche.

item.title: Germany Arrests 4 It Says Planned Attacks on Muslim Sites
item.description: The authorities said they had broken up what they said was a far-right terrorist group that called itself the Oldschool Society.
item.dc:creator: MELISSA EDDY

item.title: Salman Khan, Bollywood Star, Found Guilty in Hit-and-Run Killing
item.description: Mr. Khan was found guilty of culpable homicide for running over five homeless men in Mumbai in 2002 while driving drunk. One of the victims died.
item.dc:creator: NIDA NAJAR
item.media:description: The Bollywood actor Salman Khan in 2014.

item.title: Germanwings Co-Pilot Appears to Have Rehearsed Fatal Dive, Report Says
item.description: Initial French findings show that he repeatedly set the planeâ€™s altitude to 100 feet during its outbound flight to Barcelona, Spain, from DÃ¼sseldorf, Germany.
item.dc:creator: NICOLA CLARK
item.media:credit: French Interior Minitry, via Agence France-Presse â€” Getty Images
item.media:description: Rescue workers at the crash site of the Germanwings Airbus A320 near Le Vernet, France, in March.

item.title: When Britain Goes to Vote, European Union May Feel the Results
item.description: If Prime Minister David Cameron returns to power, Britain will most likely hold a referendum on whether to withdraw from the European Union.
item.dc:creator: STEPHEN CASTLE
item.media:description: Prime Minister David Cameron of Britain, second from right, during a campaign visit with farmers near Brecon, Wales, on Wednesday.

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Pakistanâ€™s Loss: A Beacon of Free Thought
item.description: Sabeen Mahmudâ€™s business was opening minds. She paid with her life.
item.dc:creator: BINA SHAH

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Putinâ€™s Grudging Perestroika
item.description: The leaders who have been trumpeting Soviet grandeur on the world stage are overseeing its retreat at home.
item.dc:creator: MAXIM TRUDOLYUBOV

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: In China, Pigs Are Flying. Almost.
item.description: Chinaâ€™s rural entrepreneurs have shown an inventive do-it-yourself streak, and turned diving pigs into a tourist draw and a selling point for pork, saying that diving pigs are healthier, leaner and tastier, and so sell for better prices.
item.dc:creator: CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Pigs leap from a diving platform at Shiyan Lake in Changsha, Hunan Province.

item.title: Afghan Judge Sentences 4 to Death Over Mob Killing
item.description: The judge also released many of the 49 people charged in the March killing of a woman who had been falsely accused of burning a Quran.
item.dc:creator: AHMAD SHAKIB and ROD NORDLAND
item.media:description: Defendants on trialÂ in Kabul, Afghanistan, on Wednesday in connection with the mob killing of a 27-year-old woman.

item.title: Tikrit Journal: Massacre Site in Iraq Becomes Monument to Suffering for Shiites
item.description: The slaughter of military members at Camp Speicher by the Islamic State in June has amplified distress about the toll of sectarian violence.
item.dc:creator: TIM ARANGO and ANNE BARNARD
item.media:credit: Ahmad al-Rubaye/Agence France-Presse â€” Getty Images
item.media:description: A memorial in Tikrit, Iraq, a city where 11 mass graves have been found. The first sets of remains have been sent to Baghdad for identification and eventual release to the families.

item.title: Leftist Partyâ€™s Win in Alberta May Affect Future of Oil Sands
item.description: Critics say the formations in the province, where the New Democratic Party unexpectedly prevailed, enjoyed a light regulatory touch under Conservative governments.
item.dc:creator: IAN AUSTEN
item.media:description: Supporters of the New Democratic Party in Alberta, Canada, celebrated the party's success. Rachel Notley will become the provincial premier.

item.title: Sister of Marine Veteran Imprisoned in Iran Asks Red Cross to Visit Him
item.description: The request came a day after Amir Hekmati, who has been incarcerated more than three and a half years, resumed a hunger strike.
item.dc:creator: RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Barpak Journal: High in the Himalayas, a Search After the Nepal Quake Yields Grim Results
item.description: In locations that are hard to reach in the best of times, many are still missing, and tallying the damage from an earthquake has proved difficult.
item.dc:creator: DANIEL BEREHULAK
item.media:credit: Daniel Berehulak for The New York Times
item.media:description: A mother was consoled Tuesday at her sonâ€™s funeral in Barpak, Nepal, where assessing damage has been difficult.

item.title: World Briefing: U.S. Offers Millions in Rewards for Information on ISIS Leaders
item.description: The departmentâ€™s Rewards for Justice program is offering up to $7 million for information leading to the whereabouts of four Islamic State leaders.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
Tariq Bin-al-Tahar Bin al Falih al-Awni al-Harzi

item.title: World Briefing: Iran: Rights Advocate Is Arrested
item.description: Narges Mohammadi, one of the best-known activists remaining in Iran, has worked with the Defenders of Human Rights Center.
item.category: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
item.dc:creator: THOMAS ERDBRINK

item.title: World Briefing: Saudi Arabia: Yemeni Rebels Attack
item.description: Rebels in Yemen struck a border town in Saudi Arabia with mortar and rocket fire on Tuesday, damaging buildings and leading the national airline to cancel flights to the area.
item.dc:creator: BEN HUBBARD

item.title: Congressional Memo: Tom Cottonâ€™s Procedural Move Interrupts Smooth Sailing for Iran Bill
item.description: The senatorâ€™s push for an amendment on legislation giving Congress a voice in any nuclear deal with Iran appeared to be a transparent effort to undermine the whole bill.
item.dc:creator: JENNIFER STEINHAUER
item.media:description: Senator Tom Cotton, Republican of Arkansas, in the Capitol subway in Washington on Tuesday.

item.title: Al Jazeera America, Its Newsroom in Turmoil, Is Now the News
item.description: A lawsuit and an exodus of top executives have revealed grievances that employees say reflect a deep dysfunction in management of the newsroom.
item.dc:creator: JOHN KOBLIN
item.media:description: Ehab al Shihabi, right, chief executive of Al Jazeera America, spoke to reporters in 2013 at the companyâ€™s office in New York.

item.title: Texas Attacker Left Trail of Extremist Ideas on Twitter
item.description: An attack in which both gunmen were killed shows the difficulty of pinpointing true threats among a groupâ€™s social media chatter.
